name: Cedar Lodge Motel & RV Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good value for a clean spacious room. Lassen Volcanic park a bit of a drive. Motel is within a mile or two of a variety of dining choices.
reviews.title: Nice for a night or two

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great and relatively inexpensive place to stay. The reasons we liked Cedar Lodge are as follows: 1) the staff is very friendly (but not overly); 2) the beds are really comfortable for the price (firm mattresses an important plus after a full day traveling and/or in great outdoors); 3) the location is great - awesome coffee shop/bakery right next door, very close to Lassen National Park, great Mtn biking, hiking (which is what we like to do, but apparently great for winter sports, hunting, boating and fishing); 4) free DVD rental on site); 5) well maintained and clean.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: First of all, please disregard the comment left by DDJB and the title "YOU CAN'T BE SERIOUS" He or she is a complete idiot or pampered little princess who can't handle anything less than a 4 star. The accommodations for what you can expect for a motel given how hard it was to find one in Chester on a weekend was outstanding!! Kudos to AL! He's the man! Everything you want to know about the area and and how to catch the lunkers, he's as straight up as they get! Agreed! Katherine too is as helpful as a hostess can get! OH! I can't forget to mention! "If you own an ATV, you best bring it here (there is a cool little course and trails galore, just ask AL)
reviews.title: Yes folks, I approve! Please read!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights here. The walls between rooms are better sound-proofed than most other motels. Once in a while we could hear people talking in an adjacent room, but it was quite muffled. Decorations were homey and unique. Both staff members we dealt with were genuinely helpful, friendly, and kind. Absolutely would (and will) stay here again. All rooms were non-smoking. Our room had a mini-fridge and microwave. The wifi worked well the times we tried it.
reviews.title: We felt truly welcomed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we come to this area to hike or ski we always stay here. The rooms are very comfortable and the owners are very hospitable and really made us feel at home. the last time we stayed they had a bonfire in the back that the patrons were welcome to sit around. We thought it was awesome to sit by the campfire and at the end of the night be able to go back to a very clean and cozy room to watch one of the many DVD's that the office has available. The dogs love staying here to!! When we come in the winter we can literally walk across the street and go cross country skiing. a great place to stay and we would reccommend it anyone planning to stay in this area, pam sadie and patches will be back!!
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sure did feel homey. The owners are terrific & the room was cozy.
reviews.title: Tucked away

likes.liked: — the warm greeting & the fridge & micro tucked away

reviews.text: The fridge & micro were great for dinner leftovers & warming the goods from the bakery. The pool was not open...but we were there late in the season. Tried to come back for another stay on the way home...but without a reservation.....there was "no rrom at the inn" :0) Recommend this little place to all who want a less "formal" place & who want to feel like they just met some new friends
reviews.title: Cute cozy and clean

reviews.text: Well I think Katherine, is great! she will go out of her way just to please you. During the winter its great. The area is great for riding. Even in the summer its very pleasent, when ever i go to chester i chose Cedar Lodge. Its great for fishing, hunting, wheeling. The pool is refreshing, they re-did it a few years ago so its nice and you can defintely take your family there. I would recomend this motel to anyone that is going to chester.
reviews.title: Everything is Great!

reviews.text: I've stayed at the Cedar Lodge numerous times over the years, usually while on fishing-related road trips. The large (dual) rooms with kitchenette are perfect for such trips, allowing for separate sleeping quarters as well as a place to prepare an early morning breakfast. The owners (Al and Kathy) are friendly and helpful, and Al can usually provide up-to-date fishing reports. You can't go wrong with the Cedar Lodge.
reviews.title: A perfect place to stay for the sportsman and traveler..

reviews.text: This is the first time I was steered wrong by my friends from Tripadvisor.
reviews.title: You can't be serious.

reviews.text: Other than a comfotable bed, this place was a dump. It was 90 degrees out and our miniscule room had no ventilation. The windows were closed when we got there, and the squeaking ceiling fan only served to circulate the hot air.
reviews.title: best place to stay in chester area

likes.liked: — the owners attitude and the cleanliness/comfort of the room

reviews.text: The carpeting and furniture should have been replaced years ago.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly and up front staff who work to make you comfortable. The motel is to the west a few hundred feet of the intersection of CA 89 and CA 36 which makes is very convenient for getting to all the recreation sites around Lake Almanor and about 20 miles from Mt. Lassen Park.....like many of the "mom and pop" motels in the area there is an attached RV camp site but this operation is cleaner and friendlier than all the others I have stayed in. Most of the guests seem to be early risers since at the crack of dawn they want to get out of doors and enjoy the country. There is a friendly Bakery next door but it doesn't open until 7:30 so you have to go to town (Chester-3 miles) for breakfast. The Kopper Kettle opens at 5am and serves great food.
reviews.title: Very Accomodating Accomodations!

reviews.text: We were visiting Lassen. Cedar Lodge is convenient and Chester is a great little town. In addition to going to Lassen's main southwest entrance you can enter right in Chester just a few minutes from Cedar Lodge. Great hiking, swimming, and gorgeous! Owners could not be nicer, friendlier or more helpful. It's not luxurious by any means but very pleasant and perfectly clean.
reviews.title: Great for the money, friendly helpful owners

reviews.text: i stayed here with my family (and dog!) while we visited lassen. wonderful! very very friendly owners and staff and a TON of movies that they'll let you borrow completely free! The pool was very nice and there are some pool toys provided. we all thought the two bedroom unit we stayed in was clean and very well taken care of. really cozy atmosphere. it's next door to a bakery that was packed every day that we were there (unfortunately we didn't get an oppurtunity to try them out). my mother is talking about how she plans on inviting another family to stay here next time, and i'm trying to talk my boyfriend into returning with me as well!
reviews.title: lovely!

reviews.text: all in all i would absolutely stay here again!
reviews.title: Handy for Lassen Park

reviews.text: Friendly and helpful owners who seem to care about their guests. We stayed here as a convienient place for Lassen Park which is about 20 miles away. The motel is a standard single storey motel of about 10 rooms or so. Rooms don't have air conditioning and on the rare occasions when the temperatures are in the 90's, as they were when we were there, the rooms can be quite hot. But night time temps soon drop into the 40's even in summer.
reviews.title: i didnt want to go home

aka: Cedar Lodge Motel & Rv Park Hotel Chester
description: Located 1.5 miles west of Chester in a wooded setting, our lodge offers a variety of accommodations including Queen, King, Kitchen, & 2-bdrm units. In addition to kitchenettes, our rooms also have a fridge, microwave, in-room coffee, TV/DVDs, and WiFi. Property amenities also include BBQs, picnic & play areas.
